About the job
    


Job Description
The Future Talent Program features internships that last up to 12 weeks and will include one or more projects. These opportunities in our Research & Development Division can provide you with great development and a chance to see if we are the right company for your long-term goals.
Responsibilities Include The Following
The Healthcare Analytics Center (ACE) within Global Medical & Scientific Affairs (GMSA) is using analytics to inform capabilities of the organization. We are currently recruiting for a summer intern aspiring to pursue a career in data science to work with our team as a Medical Data Scientist Intern. The Medical Data Scientist Intern will work with data scientists on the ACE team to use data and analytics to further understand how the organization can best help the patients we serve.
Review literature and other resources to gain knowledge of subject areaGain familiarity in methodologies to analyze Real World Data assets (e.g., medical claims datasets, electric health records)Process data in preparation for analysisUse analytic tools (e.g., Python, R, SAS, SQL) to conduct statistical / machine learning analyses to derive insightsPresent findings to team and key stakeholders
Required Education & Experience
Candidates must be enrolled in a full-time bachelor's degree programCandidates must have completed at least 2 years of undergraduate education by June of 2023Candidates must be available to work full-time beginning on 5JUN23Candidates must have strong statistical analysis skillsCandidates must be fluent in at least one analytic programming language (Python, R, SAS, or SQL)Candidates must have familiarity with MS Office Suite Products (Excel, PowerPoint)Candidates must have experience presenting to audiences with broad expertiseCandidates must have the ability to work both collaboratively in a team and independently
Preferred Experience & Skills
Candidates should have some graduate school completionCandidates should be studying for a technical field degree (e.g., computational biology, engineering, computer science, etc.)Candidates should be Fluent in PythonCandidates should have expertise in machine learning methodologiesCandidates should have experience conducting healthcare or life science research

Title: Senior Data Scientist – WestPoint WP
JD:
About the job
    


Job Description
Our Research Scientists are our Inventors. We identify and target steps in disease mechanisms or pathways that could be inhibited or enhanced. Our goal is to isolate a compound that is effective against a disease target. Using innovative thinking, state-of-the-art facilities and robust scientific methodology we collaborate to discover the next medical breakthrough.
Become part of a cutting-edge Quantitative Biosciences department. Using robust scientific methodology, novel translational models, state-of-the-art instruments, and automated equipment, we engage in multidisciplinary collaborations to discover the next medical breakthrough. We have added new capability enhancements that allow high-resolution interrogation of novel biology and the determination of the molecular mechanism of action of new chemical entities that help advance the best drug candidates to the clinic.
As a Senior Data Scientist within the Quantitative Biosciences Department at our Company, you will lead statistical analyses, the implementation of novel data pipelines, and machine learning algorithms that enhance our department’s ability to discover new therapeutic targets and new drug candidates (molecules).
You will apply rigorous biostatistical and computational methods to help scientists generate novel and impactful hypotheses for target discovery and insight into data generated in areas such as the development and implementation of translational models and analysis and interpretation of large complex high content imaging data sets. You will be integral in the building and application of complex automated systems and engineering solutions to support drug and vaccine discovery. You will collaborate to enable improved data handling, analysis, and visualization of vaccine studies as well as prediction and data interpretation. Additionally, you will be responsible for providing stakeholders with an in-depth understanding of the data as well as developing novel computational pipelines and methodologies.
The ideal candidate has a strong background in statistical methodology, machine learning, data analysis and data interpretation. The successful candidate will be highly motivated, creative, curious and collaborative; they will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets. This is an ideal opportunity for candidates who are intellectually curious and analytically minded. You should be able to communicate oral and written results effectively and concisely to various stakeholders with diverse backgrounds, balance shifting priorities and build strong relationships among multidisciplinary cross-organizational teams.
Primary Responsibilities
Become part of a creative and flexible team; collaborate and work closely with scientists in biology, pharmacology, chemistry, and data science to develop strategies and novel computational approaches to detect meaningful patterns and connections in diverse sources of biological data (e.g., Translational models, HCI, cell painting, automation systems, and vaccines).Help define and contribute to our data analysis and visualization infrastructure development, including the development and implementation of new tools and analysis strategies across multiple screening platforms.Collaborate with bench scientists, therapeutic area discovery teams and across functional teams to develop biological hypotheses for computational interrogation.Publish and present your data at conferences.
You Are a Strong Fit For This Role If
You have a strong background in statistical methods and machine learning.Having research experience in deep learning, object segmentation and image-based profiling methods like Cell Painting would be of advantage.You have data analytic proficiency using Python or R, TensorFlow and Keras.You are proficient in data wrangling and comfortable working with databases.You have a track record of producing scientific publications.You have been involved in research projects in the pharmaceutical early target and drug discovery context.Having experience with multiple data modalities, e.g. genomics data and/or chemical structure data, and insights on how to integrate them with other data formats and perform interpretations is a plus.
Education Minimum Requirements
Ph.D. in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Computer Engineering, or Master’s and 2+ years of working experience in computational biology, bioinformatics and machine learning in a pharma, biotech, or academic setting.

Commercial Objectives
Candidates will be responsible for providing analytical and technical support, which includes the collection and analysis of internal and external pharmaceutical data to assist in making meaningful business decisionsCandidates will help to solve novel commercial analytic questions through tool creationProjects may be product specific or focused on issues spanning multiple products.Candidates will serve as the quantitative methodology expert by developing creative analytical solutions and applying appropriate statistical and/or machine learning methodologies to answer novel commercial analytic questions

Title: Senior Scientist, Data Science
JD:
About the job
    


Job Description
The Preclinical Development (PCD) function of our Company's Research & Development (R&D) Division in West Point, PA is seeking a Senior Scientist in data science to support ongoing and new efforts in changing the way PCD leads the assessment of drug candidates. PCD seeks to bring new understanding to pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, drug metabolism, and toxicity through data science to help prioritize future experimental studies, enable translational modeling, and discover novel biology.
The candidate will play a key role in inventing, building, and applying data science approaches to identify and characterize drug candidates with well-balanced profile. The candidate will be part of an interdisciplinary team working closely with other research functions across our Company's global organization. The position is a key collaborator with principal investigators and lab-based colleagues in optimizing experimental designs, guiding testable hypotheses, developing data visualization and predictive models at the intersection of drug R&D and data science.
Primary Responsibilities
Design, develop and deploy algorithms, optimization methods, and predictive models to enable optimized decision-making in drug R&D. Build data pipeline to capture, organize, integrate, visualize, and interpret data in drug R&D. Collaborate with data engineers and architects in IT to build a data infrastructure that addresses PCD’s scientific questions. Inform and influence project teams on decisions including experiment design, assay selection, and optimization of drug candidates. 
Education Minimum Requirements
B.S. with >= 4 years of experience or M.S. with >= 2 years of experience or Ph.D., OR upcoming expected completion of Ph.D. by May 2023, with 0-1 years of experience in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Chemical Informatics, Engineering, or related fields 
Required Experience And Skills
Expertise in programming languages: Python, R, SQL and/or JavaScript. Proficiency with statistics, algorithm design, and/or machine learning models. Skilled at manipulating high dimensional big data. Keeps current with emerging trends in data science and drug development. Strong collaboration and communication skills. 
Preferred Experience And Skills
Experiences in Amazon Web Services (AWS), and/or full-stack development. Knowledge of Molecular Biology, Biochemistry. Ability to influence scientists to adapt to positive change.

Title: AI/ML Data Scientist
JD:
About the job
    


Job Description
The Digital Operations and Innovation (DOI) group within Nonclinical Drug Safety (NDS) is seeking a motivated Data Scientist to work in the field of predictive toxicology. This role will be supporting an essential part of broader efforts within NDS to be an industry leader in the application of data sciences to drug safety prediction. The successful candidate will have a strong background in Artificial Intelligence (AI) approaches to support ongoing efforts in building predictive machine learning (ML) models for toxicology endpoints, leveraging cross-functional multifaceted pharmaceutical discovery and development data. The incumbent will apply AI approaches to understand and improve drug de-risking, and safety prediction to influence early pipeline decision making.
Key Responsibilities
Inform prioritization for in vitro and in vivo toxicology resources using QSAR, probabilistic, and neural networks ML models to predict potential on/off-target activities of drugs, to provide new mechanistic hypotheses leveraging multiple internal and external datasets such as gene-expression profiles, pharmacology, in vitro and in vivo mechanistic toxicology, among othersPrepare ML model-ready datasets by curation, integration, and harmonization of safety data from internal and external domains in partnership with the subject-matter experts across the broader PCD (Preclinical Development) and our Research Division (Company Research Laboratories) IT organizations.Work collaboratively with colleagues across multiple sites to deploy, utilize, and increase the visibility of ML approaches in selection of chemical series with a high probability of successUpskill NDS staff on the utility of predictive AI/ML approaches in drug safetyStay abreast with new developments in the field of predictive science/analytics
Qualification
Masters or Ph.D. degree in biomedical engineering, computer science, computational biology, cheminformatics, bioinformatics, and related data science fieldsProficiency in one or more programming languages such as python, R, JavaScript, requiredExperience with different statistical ML techniques (both supervised and unsupervised learning required); Familiarity with DNN, Generative AI models plusFamiliarity with relational databases and knowledge of SQL, PostgreSQLExperience with high-performance or cloud computing environmentsVersion control and related code reproducibility practices (git, documentation, etc.)Previous experience working in the pharmaceutical industry is a plusSelf-motivated with a high level of autonomyStrong interpersonal skills with a collaborative mindsetDomestic travel 10-20% is required

Title: Senior Data Scientist – Kenilworth NJ
JD:
About the job
    


Job Description
Attention NJ Applicants: In April 2020, our Company announced plans to consolidate our New Jersey campuses into a single New Jersey headquarters location in Rahway, NJ by 2023. Therefore, the NJ work location for this role will be temporarily based and the exact timing of the departmental move to Rahway, NJ will be communicated at a future date.
Overview
Become part of a cutting-edge Quantitative Biosciences department. Using robust scientific methodology, novel translational models, state-of-the-art instruments, and automated equipment, we engage in multidisciplinary collaborations to discover the next medical breakthrough. We have added new capability enhancements that allow high-resolution interrogation of novel biology and the determination of the molecular mechanism of action of new chemical entities that help advance the best drug candidates to the clinic.
The Opportunity
As a Senior Data Scientist within the Quantitative Biosciences Department at our company, you will lead statistical analyses, the implementation of novel data pipelines, and machine learning algorithms that enhance our department’s ability to discover new therapeutic targets and new drug candidates (molecules).
You will apply rigorous biostatistical and computational methods to help scientists generate novel and impactful hypotheses for target discovery and insight into data generated in DEL, mRNA Display, traditional High Throughput Screening technologies as well as high content imaging. You will be adept at using large complex data sets to profile/stratify new chemical matter within and between multiple screening modalities to drive our discovery programs. You will collaborate cross-discipline to develop tools to enable a more in depth understanding and alignment of sequence data generated from affinity-based screening platforms. Additionally, you will be responsible for providing stakeholders with an in-depth understanding of the data as well as developing novel computational pipelines and methodologies.
The ideal candidate has a strong background in statistical methodology, machine learning, data analysis and data interpretation. The successful candidate will be highly motivated, creative, curious and collaborative; they will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets. This is an ideal opportunity for candidates who are intellectually curious and analytically minded. You should be able to communicate oral and written results effectively and concisely to various stakeholders with diverse backgrounds, balance shifting priorities and build strong relationships among multidisciplinary cross-organizational teams.
As a Senior Data Scientist, You Will
Become part of a creative and flexible team; collaborate and work closely with scientists in biology, pharmacology, chemistry, and data science to develop strategies and novel computational approaches to detect meaningful patterns and connections in diverse sources of biological data (e.g., Cell Painting, arrayed CRISPR, DNA-Encoded Library screening, mRNA-Display, novel target types or modalities, Drug-Seq).Help define and contribute to our data analysis and visualization infrastructure development, including the development and implementation of new tools and analysis strategies across multiple screening platforms.Collaborate with bench scientists, therapeutic area discovery teams and across functional teams to develop biological hypotheses for computational interrogation.Publish and present your data at conferences.
Minimum Required Education
Ph.D. in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Computer Engineering, or Master’s and 2+ years of working experience in computational biology, bioinformatics and machine learning in a pharma, biotech, or academic setting.
Required Experience And Skills
You have a strong background in statistical methods and machine learning.Having research experience in deep learning, object segmentation and image-based profiling methods like Cell Painting would be of advantage.You have data analytic proficiency using Python or R, TensorFlow and Keras.You are proficient in data wrangling and comfortable working with databases.You have a track record of producing scientific publications.You have been involved in research projects in the pharmaceutical early target and drug discovery context.Having experience with multiple data modalities, e.g. genomics data and/or chemical structure data, and insights on how to integrate them with other data formats and perform interpretations is a plus.

Title: Senior Data Scientist – Kenilworth NJ
JD:
About the job
    


Job Description
Attention NJ Applicants: In April 2020, our Company announced plans to consolidate our New Jersey campuses into a single New Jersey headquarters location in Rahway, NJ by 2023. Therefore, the NJ work location for this role will be temporarily based and the exact timing of the departmental move to Rahway, NJ will be communicated at a future date.
Overview
Become part of a cutting-edge Quantitative Biosciences department. Using robust scientific methodology, novel translational models, state-of-the-art instruments, and automated equipment, we engage in multidisciplinary collaborations to discover the next medical breakthrough. We have added new capability enhancements that allow high-resolution interrogation of novel biology and the determination of the molecular mechanism of action of new chemical entities that help advance the best drug candidates to the clinic.
The Opportunity
As a Senior Data Scientist within the Quantitative Biosciences Department at our company, you will lead statistical analyses, the implementation of novel data pipelines, and machine learning algorithms that enhance our department’s ability to discover new therapeutic targets and new drug candidates (molecules).
You will apply rigorous biostatistical and computational methods to help scientists generate novel and impactful hypotheses for target discovery and insight into data generated in DEL, mRNA Display, traditional High Throughput Screening technologies as well as high content imaging. You will be adept at using large complex data sets to profile/stratify new chemical matter within and between multiple screening modalities to drive our discovery programs. You will collaborate cross-discipline to develop tools to enable a more in depth understanding and alignment of sequence data generated from affinity-based screening platforms. Additionally, you will be responsible for providing stakeholders with an in-depth understanding of the data as well as developing novel computational pipelines and methodologies.
The ideal candidate has a strong background in statistical methodology, machine learning, data analysis and data interpretation. The successful candidate will be highly motivated, creative, curious and collaborative; they will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets. This is an ideal opportunity for candidates who are intellectually curious and analytically minded. You should be able to communicate oral and written results effectively and concisely to various stakeholders with diverse backgrounds, balance shifting priorities and build strong relationships among multidisciplinary cross-organizational teams.
As a Senior Data Scientist, You Will
Become part of a creative and flexible team; collaborate and work closely with scientists in biology, pharmacology, chemistry, and data science to develop strategies and novel computational approaches to detect meaningful patterns and connections in diverse sources of biological data (e.g., Cell Painting, arrayed CRISPR, DNA-Encoded Library screening, mRNA-Display, novel target types or modalities, Drug-Seq).Help define and contribute to our data analysis and visualization infrastructure development, including the development and implementation of new tools and analysis strategies across multiple screening platforms.Collaborate with bench scientists, therapeutic area discovery teams and across functional teams to develop biological hypotheses for computational interrogation.Publish and present your data at conferences.
Minimum Required Education
Ph.D. in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Computer Engineering, or Master’s and 2+ years of working experience in computational biology, bioinformatics and machine learning in a pharma, biotech, or academic setting.
Required Experience And Skills
You have a strong background in statistical methods and machine learning.Having research experience in deep learning, object segmentation and image-based profiling methods like Cell Painting would be of advantage.You have data analytic proficiency using Python or R, TensorFlow and Keras.You are proficient in data wrangling and comfortable working with databases.You have a track record of producing scientific publications.You have been involved in research projects in the pharmaceutical early target and drug discovery context.Having experience with multiple data modalities, e.g. genomics data and/or chemical structure data, and insights on how to integrate them with other data formats and perform interpretations is a plus.
We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we “follow the science” that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.
Who We Are …
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
What We Look For …
Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Title: Senior Data Scientist – Kenilworth NJ
JD:
About the job
    


Job Description
Attention NJ Applicants: In April 2020, our Company announced plans to consolidate our New Jersey campuses into a single New Jersey headquarters location in Rahway, NJ by 2023. Therefore, the NJ work location for this role will be temporarily based and the exact timing of the departmental move to Rahway, NJ will be communicated at a future date.
Overview
Become part of a cutting-edge Quantitative Biosciences department. Using robust scientific methodology, novel translational models, state-of-the-art instruments, and automated equipment, we engage in multidisciplinary collaborations to discover the next medical breakthrough. We have added new capability enhancements that allow high-resolution interrogation of novel biology and the determination of the molecular mechanism of action of new chemical entities that help advance the best drug candidates to the clinic.
The Opportunity
As a Senior Data Scientist within the Quantitative Biosciences Department at our company, you will lead statistical analyses, the implementation of novel data pipelines, and machine learning algorithms that enhance our department’s ability to discover new therapeutic targets and new drug candidates (molecules).
You will apply rigorous biostatistical and computational methods to help scientists generate novel and impactful hypotheses for target discovery and insight into data generated in DEL, mRNA Display, traditional High Throughput Screening technologies as well as high content imaging. You will be adept at using large complex data sets to profile/stratify new chemical matter within and between multiple screening modalities to drive our discovery programs. You will collaborate cross-discipline to develop tools to enable a more in depth understanding and alignment of sequence data generated from affinity-based screening platforms. Additionally, you will be responsible for providing stakeholders with an in-depth understanding of the data as well as developing novel computational pipelines and methodologies.
The ideal candidate has a strong background in statistical methodology, machine learning, data analysis and data interpretation. The successful candidate will be highly motivated, creative, curious and collaborative; they will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets. This is an ideal opportunity for candidates who are intellectually curious and analytically minded. You should be able to communicate oral and written results effectively and concisely to various stakeholders with diverse backgrounds, balance shifting priorities and build strong relationships among multidisciplinary cross-organizational teams.
As a Senior Data Scientist, You Will
Become part of a creative and flexible team; collaborate and work closely with scientists in biology, pharmacology, chemistry, and data science to develop strategies and novel computational approaches to detect meaningful patterns and connections in diverse sources of biological data (e.g., Cell Painting, arrayed CRISPR, DNA-Encoded Library screening, mRNA-Display, novel target types or modalities, Drug-Seq).Help define and contribute to our data analysis and visualization infrastructure development, including the development and implementation of new tools and analysis strategies across multiple screening platforms.Collaborate with bench scientists, therapeutic area discovery teams and across functional teams to develop biological hypotheses for computational interrogation.Publish and present your data at conferences.
Minimum Required Education
Ph.D. in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Computer Engineering, or Master’s and 2+ years of working experience in computational biology, bioinformatics and machine learning in a pharma, biotech, or academic setting.
Required Experience And Skills
You have a strong background in statistical methods and machine learning.Having research experience in deep learning, object segmentation and image-based profiling methods like Cell Painting would be of advantage.You have data analytic proficiency using Python or R, TensorFlow and Keras.You are proficient in data wrangling and comfortable working with databases.You have a track record of producing scientific publications.You have been involved in research projects in the pharmaceutical early target and drug discovery context.Having experience with multiple data modalities, e.g. genomics data and/or chemical structure data, and insights on how to integrate them with other data formats and perform interpretations is a plus.
